item.title: Laszlo Krasznahorkai Is Awarded Nobel Prize in Literature
item.description: ​The prize committee said the Hungarian writer’s work “reaffirms the power of art.”

item.title: A Breakthrough Hostage Deal, and an Arrest in Deadly L.A. Wildfire
item.description: Plus, Dolly Parton wants you to know she “ain’t dead yet.”

item.title: China Clamps Down Even Harder on Rare Earth Exports
item.description: The move is Beijing’s latest attempt to tighten control over global production of the metals, which are essential to the manufacture of computer chips...

item.title: At the Met’s ‘Divine Egypt,’ the Gods are Eternally Fabulous

item.title: New York Fed’s John Williams Favors More Rate Cuts
item.description: John Williams, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, is primarily concerned with weakness in the labor market.
